subject: Communication
title: Teaching EQ: Can Schools Change Hearts?
description: Learn Teaching EQ: Can Schools Change Hearts? in one minute.

hook.text: A school in New Haven taught emotional literacy. Suspensions dropped 50%. Test scores rose.

buildup.text: Social-Emotional Learning (SEL) programs teach children to identify emotions, manage them, show empathy, and navigate.

discovery.text: A meta-analysis of 213 studies showed SEL programs improve academic achievement by 11 percentile points and reduce.

twist.text: Critics worry SEL is 'soft' or distracts from academics. The data shows the opposite: emotional skills boost cognitive.

climax.text: Countries like Singapore, Finland, and Australia now embed EQ into their national curricula.

punchline.text: The most important subject in school might be understanding yourself.

quiz.question: By how many percentile points does SEL improve academic achievement?
